title: Radiation Physicist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Lakeridge Health
Interview Descriptions: took a few weeks, they emailed and we set up a virtual interview (during covid) and then reached back through HR a few weeks later followed by references and security checks.
Interview Questions: what do you value about Lakeridge

title: RPN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Lakeridge Health in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: I applied online through the hospital website and received a call from HR a few days later. It took a more few days to get in contact with the HR person but once that happened, the interview was scheduled. The interview was online and took about 30 minutes in total.
Interview Questions: "What would you do if you have a patient who is having SOB and chest pain"

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Lakeridge Health
Interview Descriptions: My interview was during covid, you had to zoom in with about four interviewers. They asked questions, a lot about your character and how you would respond to situations.  There is also a math test you have to pass, was pretty simple as far as I remember.
Interview Questions:
Interview (some questions they asked me) 
•	
•	Don’t say you don’t know- what would you do if you dont know 
•	Pt flow.. bed flow, how to make it an easier transition 
•	What does pt care mean to you.. look at it with their values 
•	Describe a time where a pt was upset and what did you do 
•	When you made a mistake and what did you learn 
•	a time with conflict and how did you manage it (with colleague) 
•	What kind of direction you are looking for in your career
•	 How do you mange stress
•	Pt with chest pain what are steps you’ll go through 
•	What kind of worker are you 
•	Pt SOB steps you will take 
•	Strengths and weaknesses‼ 
•	Reap assessment walk ya through Head to toe 
•	
•	Hypoglycemia.. what are the steps

title: Patient Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Lakeridge Health
Interview Descriptions: Contacted via email. Had interview on MS Teams (during pandemic). 3 interviewers from department, pleasant experience and were very friendly. Was offered a role a few weeks later. Overall easy and good experience
Interview Questions: Patient safety and how to ensure it

title: RN-NGG Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Lakeridge Health (Oshawa, ON) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: I didnt know what to expect going into it and it was my first interview as a new grad. I more so studied general questions since it wasn't for a particular unit. I thought some of the clinical questions were a bit difficult.
Interview Questions: what are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Operations Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Lakeridge Health
Interview Descriptions: Standard interview format with a panel of 3 employees (management). Was told to wait 2 weeks before a decision will be made. I asked for a feedback during a follow up however I did not receive any feedback from the organization and was left feeling discouraged from applying to that organization.
Interview Questions: Give me an example of where you used leadership skills?

title: Registered Practical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Lakeridge Health
Interview Descriptions: Very Positive and friendly. Able to answer my questions at the end, and gave clear and understandable answers. I was not as nervous as I thought I would be. Excellent.
Interview Questions: What made you choose nursing?

title: Personal Support Work Psw Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Lakeridge Health (Oshawa, ON) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: it was a phone call interview.took about 40mins. it was a good one and hope to hear from them soon.Also,i wish to apply again in the future if i dont get the job now.
Interview Questions: what will you do ensure the safety of staff and residents

title: Clinical Extern (Student Nurse) Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Lakeridge Health
Interview Descriptions: Pleasant interviewer, questions weren’t a lot, questions about: strength, weakness, confidentiality,and  medications has been asked from what I can remember. The process of applying took 1-2 months yo be offered an interview. I was heard back for the position a month later
Interview Questions: Someone ask you to give a medication. What do you do?

title: Decision Support Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Lakeridge Health
Interview Descriptions:
Got a quick response after my application. Interview was set up promptly. 

The interview itself was very awkward considering that the panel would show absolutely no interest in what i'm saying. It was complete poker face the entire time with minimal head nods to indicate understanding.

After the interview, it took almost a month and a half to hear from them. To their credit, they did mention that it would take some time.
Interview Questions:
What are OLAP cubes?
What is ETL?
Describe your technical skills as it pertains to the role.
Describe a time you had a conflict with a colleague. How did you handle it?

title: Clinical Extern (Student Nurse) Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Lakeridge Health
Interview Descriptions: After the application process, I  heard back after 2 weeks. Schedule an interview and submit references. There were 2 individuals interviewing, one asking, one writing down. Simple questions, know a little about the organization
Interview Questions: How do you handle difficult situation?

title: Clinical Extern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Lakeridge Health (Ajax, ON) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: Interview was done over zoom, and the ladies interviewing me were very friendly. Allowed me to come back to one of their questions and provided me time to provide an answer. Asked straight forward questions that one would expect for an extern position.
Interview Questions: Describe how you overcame a conflict with a coworker?

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Lakeridge Health
Interview Descriptions: It was one interview with an HR rep and the manager. It was straight forward interview questions. The people were friendly. The offer was good. Also look at examples that demonstrate you match the values of the organization.
Interview Questions: Tell us a time when you had a difficult time meeting a deadline.

title: Clinical Extern (Student Nurse) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Lakeridge Health (Oshawa, ON) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: Quick and efficient interview process. Mainly behavioural questions and scenario based questions. Interviewers facilitated the answers when unsure. It was a 2 week process and HR was very responsive. Understand the skills of a UAP to better prepare for the interview (basic care, mobility). There were a lot of safety questions regarding scope of practice.
Interview Questions: If an MD asked you something that was beyond your scope as a CLE, how would you respond?

title: RN Float Pool Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Lakeridge Health (Oshawa, ON) in Jul 2020
Interview Descriptions: had to do a math test before, pretty basic and easy. have to get i think 90% to move on and get the interview. mine was during covid so it was a video call with 2 managers. standard questions about yourself and how you handle stress full situations or what you would do if a pt has chest pain et et
Interview Questions: how you handle stress full situations or what you would do if a pt has chest pain et et

title: Patient Experience Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Lakeridge Health (Oshawa, ON) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: Face to face interview although they meet via MS Teams now. Panel of 4 taking turns asking questions. Friendly environment. Situational type questions plus a few questions to test knowledge of Healthcare system.
Interview Questions: Give an example of a difficult conversation and how you handled it

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at Lakeridge Health (Oshawa, ON) in Dec 2019
Interview Descriptions: There was a Medication calculation test first with 30 questions and then a sit down interview with clinical type questions as well as standard interview questions with the unit manager and a human resource person
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Occupational Therapist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Lakeridge Health
Interview Descriptions: Called to set up interview date. Interviewer was nice and patient. Usual interview questions. Some case questions. Some knowledge based questions regarding your position. Not too bad if you went in prepared.
Interview Questions: What do you know about us?

title: Talent Acquisition Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Lakeridge Health (Oshawa, ON) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and submitted a cover letter/resume.  Correspondence was done through email. Standard interview process, panel interview with multiple questions. Rotated through the panel asking questions to the candidate. Section at the end to ask questions that the candidate may have.
Interview Questions: situational and behavioural questions

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Lakeridge Health
Interview Descriptions: Med calculations test wasn't bad. You could use a calculator. I got one wrong, but it was actually their mistake on the test. After that, it was an interview with the manager and educator.  They were very nice.
Interview Questions: Specific critical care/emerg acls questions

title: PSw Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Lakeridge Health (Oshawa, ON) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions:
Waited for like 20 minutes so they would come get me. 
Got intimidated by 2 people interviewing me
Was really nervous, wasnt even given any assurance.
They never got back to me, even though I emailed them twice.
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you?

title: RPN Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Lakeridge Health (Oshawa, ON)
Interview Descriptions: I applied in person to a few floors. HR called to set the interview up and the interview was with the Nurse managers. Pretty basic interview, mostly asked situation based questions. Two people interviewed which is kind of intimidating one asked the question while the other wrote your answer down,
Interview Questions: example of conflict resolution

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Lakeridge Health (Oshawa, ON) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: the interview process  was good. was fairly casual. managers were nice. asked me to describe myself, tell me why id be a good candidate for the position and to describe my skills.
Interview Questions: the interview process  was good. was fairly casual. managers were nice. asked me to describe myself, tell me why id be a good candidate for the position and to describe my skills.

title: Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Lakeridge Health
Interview Descriptions: There were 2 managers. They did not ask a lot of questions about myself, other than how would I describe myself. They asked a lot of scenario based questions, using what would you do?  You have to pass a math test in order to be able to get an interview. The math test it out of 30 and you must score 27.
Interview Questions: What would you do if a patient had a fall

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Lakeridge Health (Oshawa, ON) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Can be tedious
Have a pharmacology rest now 
Can be redundant. Process is like any other really 
Panel people that interviews. The had to wait a couple of weeks.all in all the process went well and received a job in the end
Interview Questions: What would you do for someone was threatening to hurt themselves and they had a religious item in them that could potential cause self harm

title: Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Lakeridge Health (Bowmanville, ON) in Nov 2012
Interview Descriptions: Standard questionnaire from Human resources including situational questions regarding how to handle conflicts with fellow staff members, patients and their families in stressful situations.  Medical terminology testing, Micro soft word and excel testing.
Interview Questions: Situational questions

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Lakeridge Health (Oshawa, ON) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: one interview involving the pcs pcm and sometimes the director, then there is a quiz at the end regarding your skills and knowledge. it took about 3-4 weeks to hear back from them.
Interview Questions: why do you want to work here?
